lead_paragraph: At Philadelphia on June 26, 1940, a member of the House of Representatives was recognized to nominate an aspirant for the Republican candidacy for President. He had many traditions to oppose, including party regularity as a prerequisite for such a nomination. Among other things, he said of his nominee:
abstract: A Krock on efforts to read Willkie out of Repub party
